intro: Galium shengkuangense, commonly known as the Shengkuang bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Galium shengkuangense is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
